alert.note: Alert for Foard; Hardeman; Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 08 at 4:39AM CDT until May 08 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY... .Hot and very dry air will spread over western Oklahoma and western north Texas on Sunday. In areas that have not seen appreciable rainfall in recent days or weeks, much of the fuels are still dormant or in transition phase. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND ADJACENT PARTS OF NORTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. * TIMING...10 AM to 10 PM Sunday and Monday. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * TEMPERATURES...97 to 105.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
